column5: rite aid! they have a sitting scale you can use for free. my apt doesn't have any flat floors so i can't weight myself at home, so i get it. rite aid has been a huge help for me.
i'm almost 2/3 of the way to an episode of my 600 pound life wtf are you talking about
to the surprise of no one, i am a blue whale

if you can go to rite-aid they often have a scale there that is pretty quick and unobtrusive, but it's locked in the store

i have to use that one since there are no level surfaces in my apt lol 

best of luck, stay safe <3
oh i need this in my life
okay but like, why didn't you put the crackers in the soup
do you mean warm
bpd, ed, and morbidly obese, AND transgender. i feel y'all's pain something fierce.
Life is publicizing everyone's information unless you opt out, so I deleted my Life app. Switching to Zero.

Last thursday: 386 lbs

This morning: 379 lbs!!

The 380s were making me struggle so I'm so glad I'm keeping pushing through <3
for when you forget to take your warfarin and take an accidental nap in the middle of your day, "skip thinner, wake up, dinner!"
to quote xkcd, "a business major's just a thing to get so you can graduate." i wouldn't be too concerned, honestly?

is that the trick? fuck the food instead of eating it?

it really isn't

i've been trying to do the spetsnaz thing? y'know, how they have the "they don't ignore pain, that's impossible. so instead, they learn to enjoy it" thing? i've been doing that with hunger. probably a mega-fucked way of going about it, but so far so good.
same here friend

god yes, this post is completely how i feel. except for black coffee - i'm a weenie with hot drinks! 

and since i'm starting at obscenely too big (BMI 55) it's going to take FOREVER for anyone to start asking the "i'm worried" stuff - i'll definitely get all the compliments as i shed the pounds!!!!
this is wonderful, as a trans woman with an ed\~
it isn't exhausting if you're obscenely too damn big to begin with like my over-350lb ass
